fields.summary: Eucalyptus DNS sporadically fails to resolve OSG service endpoint

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
As a cloud user I would like my credentials to be accepted by any region in my cloud so that using multiple regions is simplified.

Acceptance criteria:
Given valid non-temporary access key credentials for a federated cloud and service endpoints for each region, when I consume services in those regions via the supplied endpoints then service access succeeds or fails according to the policies applicable to my credentials.

comments.body:
Confirmed story has been completed.

Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.0-0.0.23586.540.20150623git1ad8a4a.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up federated cloud (4 regions; 2 multi-cluster, 2 single cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-regions
REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	big-krit	http://compute.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	bob	http://compute.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	ghostface-killah	http://compute.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
#* [region big-krit|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/466/]
#* [region ghostface-killah|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/465/]
#* [region bob|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/464/]
#* [region ace-hood|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/463/]
# On ace-hood region, downloaded cloud admin (eucalyptus/admin) credentials, then created account 'development-operations'
{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a development-operations
{code}
# Downloaded credentials creds for development-operations/admin user, sourced creds, then created users using IAM endpoint for each region:
{code}
# source development-operations/eucarc
# euare-userlistbypath
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/admin
# euare-usercreate -u inspectah-deck --url http://euare.g-12-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-usercreate -u u-god --url http://euare.g-05-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-usercreate -u gza --url http://euare.d-34.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-usercreate -u rza --url http://euare.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
# euare-userlistbypath
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/admin
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/inspectah-deck
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/u-god
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/gza
arn:aws:iam::001310814050:user/rza
{code}
# Created groups associated with each service (pointing to ace-hood region)
{code}
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupcreate -g autoscaling-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupcreate -g ec2-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupcreate -g cloudformation-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupcreate -g cloudwatch-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupcreate -g elb-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupcreate -g iam-users
{code}
# Added users to each group
{code}
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u u-god -g s3-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u gza -g autoscaling-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u inspectah-deck -g ec2-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u gza -g cloudformation-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u rza -g cloudformation-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u raekwon -g cloudwatch-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u masta-killa -g elb-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupadduser -u cappadonna -g iam-users
{code}
# Created IAM access policies for each service, and applied it to the corresponding group (policies attached):
{code}
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name s3-access -f s3-access-allresources.json -g s3-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name autoscaling-access -f autoscaling-access-allresources.json -g autoscaling-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name ec2-access -f ec2-access-allresources.json -g ec2-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name cloudformation-access -f cloudformation-access-allresources.json -g cloudformation-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name cloudwatch-access -f cloudwatch-access-allresources.json -g cloudwatch-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name elb-access -f elb-access-allresources.json -g elb-users
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euare-groupuploadpolicy --policy-name iam-access -f iam-access-allresources.json -g iam-users
{code}
# Created directory for each user and downloaded creds for each user
# For each service, tested the user of the group that corresponded to each service
#* *OSG (S3)*
{code}
root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ace-hood --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 02:10  s3://nginx-logs
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-big-krit --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 03:49  s3://mongodb-logs
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-bob --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 02:11  s3://apache-logs
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 03:51  s3://redis-logs
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ace-hood --signature-v2 mb s3://golden-arms-redemption
Bucket 's3://golden-arms-redemption/' created
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-big-krit --signature-v2 mb s3://mr-xcitement

Bucket 's3://dopium/' created

Bucket 's3://the-keynote-speaker/' created
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ace-hood --signature-v2 put ks-post.log s3://golden-arms-redemption/ks-post.log
ks-post.log -> s3://golden-arms-redemption/ks-post.log  [1 of 1]
 22194 of 22194   100% in    3s     7.07 kB/s  done
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-big-krit --signature-v2 put ks-post.log s3://mr-xcitement/ks-post.log
ks-post.log -> s3://mr-xcitement/ks-post.log  [1 of 1]
 22194 of 22194   100% in    3s     6.22 kB/s  done
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah --signature-v2 mb s3://the-keynote-speaker
Bucket 's3://the-keynote-speaker/' created
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-bob --signature-v2 put ks-post.log s3://dopium/ks-post.log
ks-post.log -> s3://dopium/ks-post.log  [1 of 1]
 22194 of 22194   100% in    3s     6.67 kB/s  done
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah --signature-v2 put ks-post.log s3://the-keynote-speaker/ks-post.log
ks-post.log -> s3://the-keynote-speaker/ks-post.log  [1 of 1]
 22194 of 22194   100% in    3s     7.07 kB/s  done
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ace-hood --signature-v2 la
2015-06-30 13:58     22194   s3://golden-arms-redemption/ks-post.log


[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ace-hood --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-30 13:35  s3://golden-arms-redemption
2015-06-26 02:10  s3://nginx-logs
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-big-krit --signature-v2 la

2015-06-30 13:59     22194   s3://mr-xcitement/ks-post.log

[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-big-krit --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 03:49  s3://mongodb-logs
2015-06-30 13:36  s3://mr-xcitement
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-bob --signature-v2 la

2015-06-30 14:00     22194   s3://dopium/ks-post.log


[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-bob --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 02:11  s3://apache-logs
2015-06-30 13:36  s3://dopium
2015-06-30 13:37  s3://the-keynote-speaker
[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah --signature-v2 la

2015-06-30 14:00     22194   s3://the-keynote-speaker/ks-post.log

[root@g-19-05 ~]# ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=development-operations/u-god/.s3cfg-devops-ghostface-killah --signature-v2 ls
2015-06-26 03:51  s3://redis-logs
2015-06-30 14:00  s3://the-keynote-speaker
{code}

#* *Compute (EC2)*
{code}

REGION	ace-hood	http://compute.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/

[root@g-19-05 ~]# eulb-describe-lb-policy-types -U http://loadbalancing.g-19-05.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
POLICY_TYPE	SSLNegotiationPolicyType	Listener policy that defines the ciphers and protocols that will be accepted by the load balancer. This policy can be associated only with HTTPS/SSL listeners.
POLICY_TYPE	LBCookieStickinessPolicyType	Stickiness policy with session lifetimes controlled by the browser (user-agent) or a specified expiration period. This policy can be associated only with HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
POLICY_TYPE	BackendServerAuthenticationPolicyType	Policy that controls authentication to back-end server(s) and contains one or more policies, such as an instance of a PublicKeyPolicyType. This policy can be associated only with back-end servers that are using HTTPS/SSL.
POLICY_TYPE	ProxyProtocolPolicyType	Policy that controls whether to include the IP address and port of the originating request for TCP messages. This policy operates on TCP/SSL listeners only
POLICY_TYPE	AppCookieStickinessPolicyType	Stickiness policy with session lifetimes controlled by the lifetime of the application-generated cookie. This policy can be associated only with HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
POLICY_TYPE	PublicKeyPolicyType	Policy containing a list of public keys to accept when authenticating the back-end server(s). This policy cannot be applied directly to back-end servers or listeners but must be part of a BackendServerAuthenticationPolicyType.
